intro: Koanophyllon hidrodes, commonly known as the Hawaiian rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, green leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in rocky, coastal areas and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
